captions.text:
"Sign Language".
Daniel, Anderson and Gustavo will play.

How does it work?
Anderson will interview Daniel

and Gustavo will translate it
to sign language for you.

Daniel is a specialist. I'd like
to know what's his specialty?

Welcome to our show,
'Eating With You'!
Today we will talk to José!

He's a tapioca specialist!
Good afternoon, José!

Peace!
Peace to everybody at home...
It's more than a great pleasure...

To be here on your show with
this wonderful audience!
I'd like for you to talk about tapioca.

Few people know that tapioca
came from Colombia!

It's a mixture, a combination,
Latin America...

Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Argentina...
A lot of people, right?

So how did tapioca came to Brazil?
Was it by sea or by land?

See... Tapioca came with the
Colombian slaves to Brazil

crossing the Amazon forest to get to
the great colonizators and kings.

It was very difficult to cross
the border back then, right?
It was very difficult, my king!
They had to hid in the boat,
when they didn't got caught and whipped!

But it survived all those hardships, and now
tapioca is consumed all over the world!

And there's the breakthrough
of the sweet tapioca!
Which was invented by the French!

- What's the sweet...
- Do you know who liked the most?
